1. Your full name: Frank A.E. Ziegler
2. Your address: RA #5 Hay River, ON
3. Date: 2/24/1962
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): New Germany, Ontario, Canada
5. What was your father's name and occupation? Christian Redden
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): 1905
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible: 1905-1915 England, 1915-1919 Saskatchewan
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I" was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.)
9. What were your reasons for coming West? Opporunity Living
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?) Returning Harvesters
1. Your full name: Frank A.E. Ziegler
2. Year address: RA #5 Hayburny 2+ Cn
3. Date: 22/4/1963
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): New Germany, Ontario, Canada
5. What was your father's name and occupation? Christian Redman Railhead Webbash
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): 1905
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible: 1905-1918 England, 1918-1920 Canada
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.)
9. What were your reasons for coming West? Oppor living own
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?)
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other groups)?

13. What means of transportation did you use?

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?

16. Where did you settle or take up land?

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, since you came?
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home? Every 2 weeks.

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage. Louie had 7th Bore 1906 Redjims Xmas.

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommendation? It was a place to settle.

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, tell when they came and where they settled. Brother George joined Canadian.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record? Prove Supply Team for Grand South and East 75 days.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?

25. What was the first thing you bought after settling?
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.

21. Did anyone else come to Salt Lake City because of your recommendation or a place to settle?

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, tell when they came and where they settled.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?
25. When was the first car used in the community? 1912

26. If you owned a car before 1914, when did you buy it? What make?

27. Where was your trading center? How far from your home? (Indicate any changes due to new towns appearing, better means of travel, etc.)

28. Did you continue to trade there? (Indicate any changes due to new towns appearing, better means of travel, etc.) After World War I

29. How often did you shop in the early days? Once in 9 months for lumber

30. When (if ever) did people in your district first start going to town regularly on Saturdays?

31. When (if ever) did you first begin to buy through the mail order catalogues? What kind of articles did you buy in this way? Indicate also what fraction of your total purchases were by mail order and any changes in the proportion of purchases made by mail order since the pioneer period.

32. When did you first have a telephone and what company provided it?

33. When you came to Saskatchewan the first time was it with the idea of staying permanently? Yes Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision?

Good luck Homesteading
25. When was the first car used in the community? 1912

26. If you owned a car before 1914, when did you buy it? What make?

27. Where was your trading center? How far from your home? (Number of miles)

28. Did you continue to trade here? (Indicate any changes due to new towns appearing, better means of travel, etc.) Finally No

29. How often did you shop in the early days? Once in 3 months for lumber

30. When did people in your district first start going to town regularly on Saturdays? After

31. When did you first begin to buy through the mail order catalogues? What kind of articles did you buy in this way? Indicate also what fraction of your total purchases were by mail order and any changes in the proportion during the pioneer period.

32. When did you first have a telephone and what company provided it?

33. When you came to Saskatchewan the first time, was it with the idea of staying permanently? Yes

Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision?

Good luck!
34. Did any people move away from your district prior to 1914? What reasons did they have for moving?

35. Did many people move away during the 1920's? Did many return?

36. If you or some member of your family have held public office, or have been active in any organizations, mention it here, giving dates wherever possible.

37. If you or any of your family or friends were "first" to have or do something in the district, mention it here giving dates wherever possible. (Such as owning the first automobile, combining, organizing the first lodges, etc.)

38. How did the places in your community get their names? (School districts, Post Offices, villages, railway stations, creeks, hills, etc.) Try to give: (1) name and occupation of person suggesting place-name, (2) origin and meaning of the name, (3) date of its adoption, (4) any changes in names since the first name was given, date and reason for change. Give facts of new name as above in (1), (2), (3).
34. Did any people move away from your district prior to 1914? What reasons did they have for moving?

35. Did many people move away during the 1920s? Did many return?

36. If you or some member of your family have held public office, or have been active in any organizations, mention it here giving dates wherever possible.

37. If you or any of your family or friends were "first" to have or do something in the district, mention it here giving dates wherever possible. (Such as owning the first automobile, combining, organizing the first lodge, etc.)

38. How did the places in your community get their names? (School districts, Post Offices, villages, railway stations, creeks, hills, etc.) Try to give: (1) name and occupation of person suggesting place-name, (2) origin and meaning of the name, (3) date of its adoption, (4) any changes in names since the first name was given, date and reason for change. Give facts of new name as above in (1), (2), (3).
Questions regarding historical source materials:

Do you have in your possession or do you know the whereabouts of diaries, old letters, old posters and programs, minute books of community organizations, old pamphlets, old photographs, written recollections and reminiscences? (Describe.)

Would you or the person who owns them either

(1) be willing to lend them to the Provincial Archivist for copying?

(2) be willing to present them to the Archives Division of the Legislative Library, Regina,

or the Archives Office at the University in Saskatoon?

(Indicate your preference, if any)

If you have children or grandchildren, please give their names, where they live and occupations.

What do you think are the most important changes in your community since you first came West?

Roads from Treck to Polaris

Please give the names and addresses of other pioneers who could answer this questionnaire. The Beaver Bros. 97725 N East to Boos & Co. "East of Polaris"

Born There Of Pioneers Stock

If someone else has filled in this questionnaire for you, please have this person give name and address here:

RR# 5 Hagersville
